1.text: Seek not to be like evil men, neither desire to be with them:

2.text: Because their mind studieth robberies, and their lips speak deceits.

3.text: By wisdom the house shall be built, and by prudence it shall be strengthened.

4.text: By instruction the storerooms shall be filled with all precious and most beautiful wealth.

5.text: A wise man is strong: and a knowing man, stout and valiant.

6.text: Because war is managed by due ordering: and there shall be safety where there are many counsels.

7.text: Wisdom is too high for a fool, in the gate he shall not open his mouth.

8.text: He that deviseth to do evils, shall be called a fool.

9.text: The thought of a fool is sin: and the detracter is the abomination of men.

10.text: If thou lose hope being weary in the day of distress, thy strength shall be diminished.

11.text: Deliver them that are led to death: and those that are drawn to death forbear not to deliver.

12.text: If thou say: I have not strength enough: he that seeth into the heart, he understandeth, and nothing deceiveth the keeper of thy soul, end he shall render to a man according to his works.

13.text: Fat honey, my son, because it is good, and the honeycomb most sweet to thy throat:

14.text: So also is the doctrine of wisdom to thy soul: which when thou hast found, thou shalt have hope in the end, and thy hope shall not perish.

15.text: Lie not in wait, nor seek after wickedness in the house of the just, nor spoil his rest.

16.text: For a just man shall fall seven times and shall rise again: but the wicked shall fall down into evil.

17.text: When thy enemy shall fall, be not glad, and in his ruin let not thy heart rejoice:

18.text: Lest the Lord see, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

19.text: Contend not with the wicked, nor seek to be like the ungodly:

20.text: For evil men have no hope of things to come, and the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

21.text: My son, fear the Lord and the king: and have nothing to do with detracters.

22.text: For their destruction shall rise suddenly: and who knoweth the ruin of both?

23.text: These things also to the wise: It is not good to have respect to persons in judgment.

24.text: They that say to the wicked man: Thou art just: shall be cursed by the people, and the tribes shall abhor them.

25.text: They that rebuke him, shall be praised: and a blessing shall come upon them.

26.text: He shall kiss the lips, who answereth right words.

27.text: Prepare thy work without, and diligently till thy ground: that afterward thou mayst build thy house.

28.text: Be not witness without cause against thy neighbour: and deceive not any man with thy lips.

29.text: Say not: I will do to him as he hath done to me: I will render to every one according to his work.

30.text: I passed by the field of the slothful man, and by the vineyard of the foolish man:

31.text: And behold it was all filled with nettles, and thorns had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall was broken down.

32.text: Which when I had seen, I laid it up in my heart, and by the example I received instruction.

33.text: Thou wilt sleep a little, said I, thou wilt slumber a little, thou wilt fold thy hands a little to rest:

34.text: And poverty shall come to thee as a runner, and beggary as an armed man.
